review: Excellent drug for me personally as all others had terrible side affects. Lowered BP nicely within acceptable limits.

8 days ago I was put on 40 mg to start and just a few hours after taking the first dose, I started to feel awful. Strange sensation in my mouth, crippling malaise/lethargy, disturbed sleep patterns.It destroyed my daily life. The doctor that prescribed it, told me to stop immediately after I mentioned the symptoms, and after 36 hours I'm starting to feel better. That was a hard lesson to get back on the exercise bike and walk more.I know BP meds are tricky and each patient reacts differently, so I cannot say this is a bad choice for all but be wary and don't be afraid to tell your doc it is not working or is not tolerable.
I’ve been on Telmisartan 20mg for just under four weeks.  BP has been considerably reduced from average 160/96 approx to 120/70!  No noticeable side effects. I am very happy happy

I've been on Micardis (telmisartan) for 15 years. It works - but I do experience side effects of being unsteady when I walk; and periodically (every 4-5 years) I need to change meds for 90-180 days because ankles swell. My Dr and I return to telmisartan because of it's overall effectiveness and kidney protection, but the swelling pattern is consistent having now occurred 3-4 times with discontinuing use for a while resolving the swelling.

Cardiologist started me at 80mg dose which lowered my blood pressure but dizziness and vertigo were so bad it was not worth it. Did some research on herbs and found old garlic extract that people raved about with similar conditions. I take 1000mg tablet each day. I reduced my telmisartan to 40mg. recently along with my garlic. Vertigo has decreased  considerably. I am planning on going off telmisartan shortly to see if I can maintain a 129/69 with just the garlic tablets.

My doctor too me off Amlodipine and Losartan and put me on Micardis now up to 80mg a day and it has not helped my blood pressure at all, in fact my blood pressure has gone up! She didn’t want to believe me, had me bring in my blood pressure machine, then said it was inaccurate and would not change to another med,  so I in the process of finding another doctor altogether

Heart doc put me on this for CHF with "high" bp (139/90).  Yes, it brings down the BP.  On only 20mg daily, mine went down to 95/65 pretty consistently.  However, it made me so tired that I couldn't function.  Sleeping 10-12 hours a day and exhausted when awake.  Took myself off and I'm at 130/75, and feel like myself again.  I know he's not going to be happy, but what good is supposedly prolonging your life when you're too tired to enjoy it?  Trying some natural ways now.  It DOES work.  The side effects are just too much for me.

Micardis (telmisartan):I have been on Cozaar 50 mg (brand name for Lozartan) for 15 years. Apart for stuffy nose, it worked well. However, in 2020 it started to wear off as I waked up with high BP and shortness of breath. 3 months ago, my Dr changed to Micardis 40 MG, then increased to 60 mg. Since then on Micardis, I developed anxiety and very awful insomnia in spite that I swim regularly. I am planning to quit this awful medicine, and see a cardiologist.
Micardis (telmisartan):Took Micardis 80mg once a day for 3 weeks. It didn't lower my BP at all.  You would think a pill that costs $233.00 per month would do something to lower your BP.

Tried telmisartan for HBP as my father was on it. It DID control the BP, BUT, I developed awful palpitations, found to have frequent (4/min) PVC's, and with exercise and/or anxiety had trigeminy and bigeminy. Did not resolve with beta-blocker. Stopped telmisartan, PVC's resolved in about 7-10 days. As taught in med school, when the patient is getting sicker, sometimes it is best to stop all of the meds.

I was on Coversyl for high blood pressure for a few years.  Doing a fairly decent job. Then I was switched to telimistran 40mg because I have Pulmonary Fibrosis to rule out the cough associated with this condition to my BP med.  I was put on telemistran and I feel lousy.  My legs feel like they weigh a ton,  my sinus issues are magnified,  dizziness is present and I get these headaches which are hard to get rid of.  Not to mention irritability , sleeplessness and confusion.  I'm taking myself off.  I'd rather gave the disease than the cure.

I've had poorly controlled high blood pressure since age 20, and  now age 69. I've taken many different blood pressure meds with little success. I had a stroke in August 2020 and I was taking 4 blood pressure meds at the time.  My new neurologist put me on Telmisartan. I'm taking 80mg Telmisartan for about 3 months now and my blood pressure is 100/66 to 125/77 range consistently. I can hardly believe it. I'm also losing some weight!  I do have a stuffy nose but that's no big deal, Claritin takes care of that pretty easily.  So far so good.

I stared taking telminsartan after my valsartan was recalled. It's been two years now since experiencing  extremely high levels of side effects from this medication. Vertigo feeling daily, muscle cramps in the back, legs and feet. Nausea feeling and stomach cramps. Both medications seem to have the same effects on me. Until my valsartan recall, I would not have know just how bad these medications were. After reading and following the new and health reports I have now stopped telminsartan. My doctor put me on Coversyl. I am now free from all these nasty side effects.

GENERIC is NOT the same as Micardis.  I was taking 40mg Micardis for over 15 years.  No problems other than some minor sinus issues.  Insurance made me change to GENERIC telmisartan and my BP is out of control and I have additional side effects.  My dr increased my dosage to 80mg but my BP continues to increase. My dr is trying to petition the insurance company to allow me to return to Micardis but it seems that is not eventful.

Micardis (telmisartan):I have been on 40mg Micardis 1 time per day for over 12 years and it always controlled my blood pressure.  I had a minimal side effect of nasal congestion.  Recently, my insurance decided that they would no longer cover Micardis and switch me to generic telmisartan.  The pills no longer control my BP and my doctor has increased me to 80mg and it is still not working.  Additionally, I have been dizzy and just have a general feeling of ill health.    I want to make it clear that the GENERIC is NOT the same as the name brand and I resent my insurance company for forcing me to take a product that does not work!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I have taken Telmisartan 20 mg for three days and find the effects/side effects very unpleasant and scary.  I have a constant headache, dizziness whether getting up or standing still,  increase in chest pain & dyspnea, and increase in blood pressure with systolic up to 190s & diastolic up to 90s.  This is similar to effects I had with ARBs 20 years ago but the hypertension expert I saw claimed that the newer ones had virtually no side effects.
Micardis (telmisartan):I had started Micardis for less than a week but it hasn't shown any control of my bp but update after two weeks.

Micardis (telmisartan):I have been on Micardis 40mg for over 6 years now. I must be one of the lucky ones as I have had no side effects to speak of and my Doc has been happy with my BP readings. Also pleased to note that I have dropped about 4 kilos of visceral fat with no change to my diet.
telmisartan lowered blood pressure but caused rashes. 0n the 80 dose.  One to three months

I wasn't having a problem on Micardis but if you look closely at their information provided, they don't know the long-term effect of 80mg p/day and they do not recommend it below 55 yrs of age which I didn't know. I took it for 11 yrs and now I am 50. Study suggests cancer chance rises slightly after taking it for 4 yrs. I stopped taking it 5 days ago and, so far, by blood pressure is lower than 120/75 at all times in the day (lower than when I took Micardis). However, I also stopped drinking coffee at the same time and haven't drank alcohol for one month.

Have taken it for over 20 yearas. Handles my blood pressure for 24 hours Its the best alternative for someone thats over weight and can't seem to lose the weight. I do get a runny nose and post nasal drip I use otc Clearall that controls it.  I tried calcium blockers but they made my ankles swell. Short of losing weight this was my best alternative

Micardis (telmisartan):MICARDIS SHOULD BE BANNED ...I HAVE BEEN TOLD I MUST TAKE IT NOW FOR SEVERAL YEARS , BUT MY REACTIONS ARE GETTING MUCH WORSE BEING 10 of the 12 side effects that they warn about.   I went off for a while felt fabulous then BP spiked doctor made me go back on the Miocardis now feel as I would be better not on this earth. Anyway  I have terrible sinusitis all the time, dry mouth, headaches, permanently exhausted , sore throat ,awful back pains , and now my kidneys are packing up. I gave up and stopped taking them 2 days ago and BP spiked again.  There has to be something better ?? I have just heard that  NHS in UK are starting a trial of a new med which is two injections a year. Wondering where you sign up  as an act of final desperation.
I have had no side effects from telmisartan I'm finally able to lose some weight and I feel fabulous my blood pressure is down from 160 / 90 averaging 127 / 76

Have had high blood pressure for 40 years (now 70) and had been put on about all the blood pressure meds (two and three at a time many times) in a vain attempt to lower my constantly high BP ( many readings above 170/100) even when on other blood pressure meds.   Then I read an article and requested to be put on Telmisartin.  Oh My God, by BP fell to the 105-125/65-80 range consistently.  If only I'd found this 20 years ago.  Absolutely NO side effects other than occasional dizzyness if I stand quickly.  Just bend over and put your hands on your knees for a moment and all is well.  Best, don't get up quickly.

I am 35 years old, have high blood pressure coz of genetic reasons. I am on telmisartan 40 mg daily (took it in morning) since last year or so. The drug lowered my blood pressure (110s/120s by 70/80s) with initial bouts of dizziness during the day, which hampered my work. I started taking telma at night to counter the day dizziness, it worked well for a year or so with no other side effects, lately I have been experiencing dizziness again, also felt vertigo like sensation once or twice, fatigue, and drained out sensation. Consulted my MD, he feels it may not be due to medication, but due to anxiety. I have continued taking medication so far.  Some days are better, some are dizzy.

Micardis (telmisartan):I was prescribed 20 mg of Micardis and like many experienced the lightheadedness, dizziness, and back pain. It also caused my throat to swell, mild nausea, vision problems, chest tightness, heartburn, the feeling I was going to faint, flushing and pressure in my head. Basically my blood pressure medication made me feel like I was going to have a heart attack and stroke. I stopped taking it 4 days ago and still have these symptoms.  Time will tell if this stuff has done permanent damage.

I have tried several medications for HBP.  Telmisartan has great 24 hour control of BP @ 80mg daily.  Orher meds such as lisinopril wear off too quick and don't offer good 24 hour control.  I have also read that telmisartan even has a slight positive effect on people that may be prediabetic with A1c of 5.7 or more.  It is true that there is some orthostatic blood pressure drop when bending over, etc but this is minor compared to other BP meds I have tried.
I started on 40 mg of telemisartan and it lowered my bp but I've been feeling depressed and have anxiety and feel like I'm going to have a panic attack. My doctor does not think it is the med.

Micardis (telmisartan):Took Micardis for about 15 years.  Did great for my blood pressure.  I also had sinus problems off and on and every time I went to Dr.  they put me on antibiotics for sinus infection.  Got to where I didn't got to the Dr. and just "bit the bullet" on the sinus problems.  One day I decided to look up all my medications and found that sinus problems were a side effect of Micardis.  I quit taking the Micardis and what do you know, my sinus problems are gone.  I've taken Micardis 80 mg/w hctz; 80 mg without hctz and 40 mg without hctz.  It works great for blood pressure, but the side effects don't warrant taking it for me.

I began taking Telmisartan (40mg)  for high blood pressure in Nov 2018 - age is 77. My pressure went back to 120/80 but as time went on I experienced muscle pain (tendinitis); difficulty in putting a sentence together, could not remember words and forgot them right away after being told what they were; gained weight; had mild headaches; swelling.  Today I decided to do a little research and I realized I was experiencing side effects.  Hopefully I will find another way to deal with my blood pressure.

I have tried this medication twice.  It did a great job in lowering my BP and pulse, but I have severe dizziness even while sitting.  I cannot walk without help.  I took it only 3 days both times.  Last time the dizziness and weakness lasted a week.  I'm hoping this doesn't happen again as I just went off it.

Micardis (telmisartan):I was diagnosed at age 47 with BP 140/90 and am a south asian. I am 56 years now and a type 1 diabetic since last 35 years. I have had no side effects and started on Micardis 40 mg by my endo and then he upped it to 80 mg to be safe. My BP is well under control and it hovers around 125-134/65-75 I check my BP everyday and keep a log by taking pics on my iphone of what it is and what food I eat. I avoid frozen food and pizzas and climb 10 floors everyday which helps it reduce by 10 points on the systolic number and bout 7-8 points on the diastolic number.  I tried the generic and had muscle pain as well as shoulder pain on my right at night time

Started  telmisartan in the morning and had to come home from work, due to a headache, being agitated and had trouble with vision. Took my BP and it was 145/106.  Rested and now it is normal and I feel better except for the lingering headache. I will take it at night and see if that helps with side effects.

Felt terrible on this medication.   I am 35 years old, In good shape, exercise and eat well but I have genetic high blood pressure, I was put on telmisartan 20 mg.  Not only did my blood pressure not improve at all but within one week I  had extreme fatigue, it was difficult for me to think clearly and had a headache all day. I  visited my doctor after 16 days, was put on a new medication and within two days my blood pressure went from the 150’s/ 160’s/95 to 125 over 81 and the symptoms have subsided completely.

researching why my body feels like garbage. Now I think I know why, because of this medicine, especially after going to 80mg. I'm tired all the time, eyesight got worse, foggy brain- hard to concentrate at work. and of course- swelling of leg and feet with dull, achy pains. It is time to get off this junk and my BP has not been lowered much due to all the pain this medicine is causing me.
Side effects were headaches, tendonitis, chest pain, diarrhea and depression.

Micardis (telmisartan):Have taken micardis for the 1st time as prescribed by my cardiologist in almost 1 week now and so far so good since I felt no side effect except for a diarrhea for the 1st 2 days
Same as some of the others. It's  the fourth week and dizziness, shallow breathing till noon and BP around 118/77. I took it as my BP spiked in gym while doing HIIT.

I am 64 year old white male that is very healthy, DASH (Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension) diet and am 163 lbs at 69".  Have been taking 20mg nightly for about a month. I was very concerned that I was having a reaction to Telmisartan initially, but decided to stay the course. My BP settled in to 133/80. I take the lowest dose that gets you in the acceptable range. I take it at night before going to bed. My side effects are:  Morning grogginess up to lunchtime,  slight tinnitus, mental sharpness.   I am noticing that it does take time to adjust to this medication.

I’m 44. I was taking micardis 40mg for the past two months without much problem except ocassional weird pressure in my head and diarrhea. It lowered my bp very well to 120/80 and below. But that could also due to me losing weight healthily and exercising for the past two months. The third month was horrible. My anxiety level went skyrocket,  I had fatigue, pressure in my head and all over the body, weak feeling in my knees and elbows. I was admitted for two days due to palpitation which was ruled out as anxiety after my echo/stress test/holter/ blood test came back fine. While wearing the holter I was 100% sure I was having palpitation but the result was otherwise. Now four days without micardis, I am still battling the withdrawal symptom. I am the unlucky one with bp medications, tried amlodipine before and had to go thru 3 weeks of terrible withdrawal symptoms.

Absolutely awful!! Didn't realise how bad it was. Have been on 40 mg for years along with 10 mg of Felodipine, and still blood pressure a problem 180/100 and even higher. Put the Telmisartan up to 80 mg and still blood pressure coming in at dangerous levels. Developed a constant cough since medication upped. Not sleeping. Exhausted, nightmares, back pain, headaches etc.GP decided to stop the Telmisartan and what do you know, been off it all together for two weeks now and blood pressure 117/120 over 65/70. Absolutely normal. The Telmisartan was actually INCREASING  my blood pressure.Should have realised the amount of times I have been hospitalised for my blood pressure and whilst they sort out medication have gone as much as 3 days without any medication and NORMAL blood pressure..Work that one out.I'm in the UK , not USA but medication is the same everywhere.

I have unbelievable back pain, insomnia, leg pain, swelling face and hands and feet , tinnitus.  It is a horrible medication and when asking the pharmacy if these reactions could be from this drug she said no! Unreal

Micardis (telmisartan):My experience has been one of falling over if I get up too quickly. Bent down to clean the floor after had dropped some food. Fell and hurt my ribs. Stopped taking Micardis the falling stopped. Have recently gone back on it and have had two falls.

Micardis (telmisartan):I suspect causation between Micardis (40mg) and BPPV. I've missed my dose a couple of times, blood pressure rocked up to 140/90's and I felt great the following day. Normally BP is 120/80's on 40mg but I feel like crap with a general level of dizzyness through the day. Sparadoic episodes but this BPPV episode has lasted 6 months now.  Worse in morning and means lying down/standing up takes special headmoves to minimise dizzy episode.

It does lower blood pressure, but my memory is bad, even with 20 triggers to remember I just move on and forget. I have aches and pains like an old man and every so often it feels like the alien is busting outa my chest. Sleep is no problem as I can drop off in a second. I now have a low low tolerance to alcohol and don't drink at all and feel like i have hangover. I can still function sexually but have taken an ED pill and blood pressure dropped to 63. OMG. I don't think this is me so I will try a beta blocker as I think I have stress related \BP
Micardis (telmisartan):This medicine is AWFUL.  Feet, ankles, bottom of legs & hands are swelling.  Did not have this on Benicar..Calling Drtomorrow for change

Hello.  I  have been using telmikind CR 40mg due to high BP. But since I have been taking it my BP is on lower side now but I got the side effect of decreased sex drive to the point it was almost completely gone. I visited my MD than he suggested to change telmikind to another strength.  I hope it will work without the side effects.

Micardis (telmisartan):I have been on Micardis 40mg then 80mg for the last 10 years. My blood pressure hovers around 140-150/90-95. I am 5'11" and weigh 105kg. I've not had any major side effects that I can tell, but recently in the last 1 year when I turned 44, I started to experience insomnia. At first it was for a few days, then weeks. The longest bout of insomnia I had was 5 weeks where I couldn't sleep (tossing/turning) until 5-6am. Thereafter I could sleep for about 2 or 3 hours before I had to get up for work. I've checked some medical websites and apparently telemisartan drugs like Micardis may cause insomnia.
Micardis (telmisartan):Works great. No known side effects at all.

Developed essential stage 1 hypertension of 150-160/90-100 at age 57. Tried Lisinopril 10mg which is the gold standard in the ACE Inhibitor class but immediately developed a gagging cough and had to stop. Next logical step was to try an Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) so switched to Telmisartan 20mg but dosage was ineffective. Upped it to 40mg and BP now averages 130/85 which is acceptable for my age. I have a medical background and have read all studies published in refereed professional journals of which there are numerous blind and controlled. Still, always be vigilant for side effects from any long term drug as they can occur without warning at any time. When it comes to essential hypertension, this is as good as it gets!

Micardis (telmisartan):I am fifty-nine years old, I have been on 40mg of Micardis for over five years now, it does control my blood pressure, but the side effects include the following. When first subscribed Micardis, leg pains were like charlie horses, lasted about 7 months, mostly at night. For the last 2 years, my insomnia is getting worse, so I started taking 2000mg of vitamin D3 that helps with insomnia, now I'm dealing with the constant coughing mostly at night. I will meet with my cardiologist within the next week, will ask for another blood pressure med.
Roach in bubblepack.  If I had ingested it with my immune system I would have died.

Micardis (telmisartan):Ive been on this tablet for 3 years now and whilst it was an initial improvement to what I had been prescribed previously its side effects do build up over time. Joint and bone aches. Memory loss,fatigue, itchy tired dry eyes, weight gain, sugar cravings, raynauds syndrome , nails and hair very slow growing.Oh and yeah I looked up what it contains and im horrified to see sodium hydroxide =caustic soda (drain cleaner) .

Micardis (telmisartan):I have been taking this medication for about 3 months now and don't think I can stand the side effects any longer. I am constantly itchy -everywhere -new rashes appear constantly. My eyes are red, swollen and itchy to the point where it now looks like I have healing black eyes.  Blood pressure down but side effects are too much.

Micardis (telmisartan):I love it.  No side effects. Tried others because of insurance.  All had lots of side effects.  I'm really upset because insurance companys are dropping it.  I can't take the generic for it.  Made me sick as a dog with severe muscle pain.
Micardis (telmisartan):Extreme fatigue, unclear thinking, aches, irritability, dizziness.
Micardis (telmisartan):Been on Micardis 40 mg for over 10 years, have had absolutely no side affects. Blood pressure is perfect, sometimes lower than 120/80.

I've tried pretty much all of the usual medications to manage my blood pressure since being diagnosed with malignant hypertension (200/130) about three years ago, and none of them did more than just take the edge off and caused new and "interesting" side effects. My Dr. suggested Micardis about four months ago, and my blood pressure has been consistently 100-110/60-70 ever since. No side effects.
I've only been on telmisartan for a couple of days, but it has lowered my blood pressure substantially with no side effects.  Hopefully it will continue.

Micardis (telmisartan):I'm white male, 53 yrs old, 5'11" and 185 lbs. I just discovered that I had High Blood Pressure about a month ago during a wellness checkup. The nurse took my blood pressure 4 times on the right arm and 3 more on the left. I was running about 180 /120. After she told me that she'd seen 400 lb men with better numbers than that I decided to see my MD. I've been on Micardis almost 30 days and it seems to have lowered it to the 140/90 range. I also was put on Bystolic just 5 days ago due to a rapid pulse of 100 bpm. Now down to 75-80. The only side effects have been occasional dizziness and some sharp pain in my hip when I move just so. I did have a scary tightening of the chest and shortness of breath the other day. It seemed to pass in about 2 mins.
Micardis (telmisartan):I have been on Micardis for more than six months without any major side effects and my blood pressure has been fairly under control, except for a few spikes from time to time.

Micardis (telmisartan):I started on Micardis 4 months ago, the first month it didn't seem to help, the second month it controlled my high blood pressure perfectly, then the third month I started getting horrible side effects. My left arm would go numb and tingly, I had horrible headaches, insomnia, diarrhea and chest pains. I was exhausted all the time yet I couldn't sleep, had terrible nightmares. The pills work great for controlling my blood pressure but the side effects are awful!

Micardis (telmisartan):I took this medicine 2 years ago for about a month because of my other hypertension medicines were causing rashes. After a couple of medicines were recommended, I took Micardis and although it lowered my pressure some, I was waking up every two hours at night. So I switched to several other medications that also did not work well. I told my MD I would try Micardis again because the side effects were less than all other medicines I had tried. So far (8 months) my pressure is better and the insomnia is workable and not so constant.

Micardis (telmisartan):On starting 40 mg Micardis experienced severe dizziness that lasted about a month, eventually subsiding. Okay for another 4 months then started to have burning and pain in feet and lower legs especially at bedtime. Had to stop even though was doing a good job with blood pressure.  Now taking Diovan and doing well.

Micardis (telmisartan):Started using Micardis HCT 40mg only 3 days ago, as an initial treatment for high blood pressure. No drastic side effects yet, except for slight dizziness, and abdominal pain related to gas (once). I am worried about sexual issues, since there are lots of reports going around saying that Micardis may hamper erectile function. Other reports say exactly the opposite!  Will have to test this on a long-time basis. All in all, seems pretty good.

Micardis (telmisartan):I had taken Micardis for about 3 years, starting from 40mg and recently 80mg. My doctor said the drug also helped prevent cardiovascular disease. The initial 40mg went well without any side effects. Blood pressure was consistently 130-140/80-90. A few months ago when I turned 38, during my routine blood pressure checks, I noticed that it was 140-150/90-100 even with the 40mg pill. Monitored this for about 2 weeks and it remained thereabouts. After consulting my doctor, he recommended a higher dosage of 80mg. It worked, and the pressure stabilized at 70-90/120-140. However, I did notice a slight discomfort in my respiratory tract or somewhat a mile heartburn (I think!).

Micardis (telmisartan):I have tried: Toporol XL, Coreg & Diovan all of these controlled my Blood pressure. But all had more side effectsthan I thought was reasonable. When I started MicardisI had some dizziness the first week. I now feel the bestI have felt since starting blood pressure medication. Mypressure is now 125-130/70-80.

Micardis (telmisartan):I have done much better on Micardis than on the other one I used to take, Cozaar. Micardis lasts longer and seems to get my pressure way down. I'd say all in all I'm very pleased.My doctor said It's a great drug.

Micardis (telmisartan):I've been on Micardis for about a year because I complained about the side effects of Accupril (dizziness). The Micardis is better but I stay around 140/90.  I've noticed a reduction in sex drive since starting this drug, all else seems okay.  I'm 35 years old.

Micardis (telmisartan):Taking Micardis, sotalol, norvasc and still run 140 over 90 to 110 blood pressure.  Been on this for years with different doctors.  They help but never get me normal blood pressure.

Micardis (telmisartan):Soon after starting Micardis I suffered from dizziness, nausea, irritability and I had no energy.  It continued, then I started shortness of breath.  Was told by my doctor it was not the medication.  I went to a cardiologist and she kept me on it and put me on Imdur.  Then severe headaches occurred.  I'm now going natural and taking my chances.

Micardis (telmisartan):I started on Micardis 80mg, good for reducing my blood pressure, but I had bad vertigo, dizzy, had too lie down, felt sickly and had cold sweats. Did not agree with me. Reduced it to 1/2 a 40mg tablet. Felt okay for a day then had vertigo again. Stopped taking tablets.

Micardis (telmisartan):Micardis has stabilized my blood pressure. I can't take the Micardis with HCT because I have had problems with my kidneys. I do feel less patient and irritable to my wife and kids.

Micardis (telmisartan):At one time I was taking as much as 5 different blood pressure medicines at a time trying to find something that would lower it from around 200/110. After a year of that I changed doctors and I was given Micardis HCT 80/12.5. That was four or five years ago and my BP is now averaging 128/74.  If there are any side effects I sure haven't noticed.
Micardis (telmisartan):Have been taking 80mg for 3 days.  Swollen ankles feet are better  but have dry mouth and am very irritable - little patience.

Micardis (telmisartan):Fantastic. Suffered minor heart attack several years ago at 37 years old, am now 41 years old. Recently started having severe chest pain and was put on Micardis 80mg, after being admitted to hospital, suspected heart attack (pain was that bad), luckly , no heart attack this time and blood pressure dropped from 196 to 125 after a couple of weeks. Feel a lot better. Now on the 40mg dose.
